# GitHub Copilot Instructions for n8n-server

## Repository Overview

This is the n8n-server repository. When contributing to this project, please follow the guidelines below.

## Code Style and Conventions

### General Guidelines
- Write clean, readable, and maintainable code
- Follow consistent naming conventions throughout the codebase
- Add comments for complex logic or non-obvious implementations
- Keep functions small and focused on a single responsibility

### File Organization
- Organize files logically based on their functionality
- Keep related files together in appropriate directories
- Use descriptive file and directory names

## Development Workflow

### Before Making Changes
- Review existing code patterns and follow them
- Ensure you understand the impact of your changes
- Check for any existing similar implementations

### Making Changes
- Make minimal, focused changes that address specific issues
- Test your changes thoroughly before committing
- Update documentation when adding or modifying features

### Commit Guidelines
- Write clear, descriptive commit messages
- Keep commits focused on a single logical change
- Reference issue numbers in commit messages when applicable

## Testing

### Testing Practices
- Write tests for new functionality
- Ensure existing tests pass before committing
- Test edge cases and error conditions
- Keep tests maintainable and well-documented

## Documentation

### Documentation Standards
- Keep README.md up to date with project changes
- Document new features and APIs clearly
- Include examples where helpful
- Update inline documentation as code changes

## Security

### Security Best Practices
- Never commit sensitive information (API keys, passwords, secrets)
- Validate and sanitize all user inputs
- Follow security best practices for your language/framework
- Keep dependencies up to date

## Pull Requests

### PR Guidelines
- Provide clear descriptions of changes
- Link to related issues
- Ensure CI/CD checks pass
- Respond to review feedback promptly
- Keep PRs focused and reasonably sized

## Additional Notes

When working with this repository:
- Always check for and respect existing patterns
- Ask questions if requirements are unclear
- Prioritize code quality over speed
- Consider backward compatibility when making changes
